channel.title: CyberNetSec - Latest Cybersecurity Articles
channel.description: Latest cybersecurity threat intelligence articles from the past 3 days

item.title: NY Regulator Puts Financial Firms on Notice: You Are Accountable for Your Vendors' Security
item.description:
The New York State Department of Financial Services (DFS) has issued new guidance for financial institutions, emphasizing their ultimate accountability for managing cybersecurity risks originating from third-party service providers (TPSPs). The regulator warned that as firms increasingly rely on clo...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Regulatory, Policy and Compliance, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Unit 42 Exposes 'Smishing Deluge' from China and 'Jingle Thief' Gift Card Fraud
item.description:
Researchers at Palo Alto Networks' Unit 42 have detailed two distinct and significant cybercrime operations. The first, a massive smishing campaign dubbed 'The Smishing Deluge,' is attributed to a China-based threat actor and is flooding mobile users globally with malicious SMS messages. The second ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Threat Intelligence, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Healthcare Breaches Seem to Drop, But Government Shutdown Hides True Numbers
item.description:
Official data for September 2025 shows only 26 major healthcare data breaches, the lowest monthly total since 2018. However, The HIPAA Journal cautions that this apparent decline is misleading. A US government shutdown has largely halted the HHS's Office for Civil Rights (OCR) from processing and up...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Palomar Health Breach Exposes Highly Sensitive Patient Data, Including Biometrics
item.description:
Palomar Health Medical Group (PHMG), a California-based healthcare provider, has announced it was the victim of a cybersecurity incident that exposed sensitive patient data. The compromised information includes not only names and personal identifiers but also highly sensitive data types such as biom...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Orders Federal Agencies to Patch New Actively Exploited Vulnerability
item.description:
On October 22, 2025, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) added a new, unspecified vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. This action confirms that the flaw is being actively exploited in the wild by malicious actors. Under Binding Operational...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical Netty Zero-Day Bypasses All Major Email Authentication
item.description:
A critical zero-day vulnerability, CVE-2025-59419, has been discovered in the widely used Netty Java library, affecting countless applications that handle email. The flaw allows an unauthenticated attacker to perform SMTP injection by embedding carriage return and line feed characters into email com...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Phishing, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Iran's MuddyWater APT Targets 100+ Governments with Phoenix Backdoor
item.description:
The Iranian state-sponsored threat group MuddyWater is conducting a large-scale cyber-espionage campaign targeting over 100 government entities, primarily in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA). According to Group-IB, the attackers are using phishing emails sent from a compromised mailbox, lever...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: Patch Now: Critical RCE Flaws in Oracle E-Business Suite Marketing Module
item.description:
Oracle has issued urgent patches for two critical, unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) vulnerabilities in its E-Business Suite. The flaws, CVE-2025-53072 and CVE-2025-62481, both carry a CVSS score of 9.8 and affect the Oracle Marketing module. An attacker with network access can exploit the...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Pwn2Own Day 1: Hackers Net $522K for 34 Zero-Days in SOHO Devices
item.description:
The first day of Trend Micro's Pwn2Own Ireland 2025 competition was a resounding success for security researchers, who earned a total of $522,500 for demonstrating 34 unique zero-day vulnerabilities. In a stunning display, every single one of the 17 scheduled attempts against popular SOHO devices—in...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, IoT Security, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: DHS Breach: 'CitrixBleed 2.0' Zero-Day Exposes FEMA & CBP Employee Data
item.description:
A critical zero-day vulnerability in Citrix NetScaler Gateway, dubbed 'CitrixBleed 2.0' (CVE-2025-5777), was exploited to breach the U.S. Department of Homeland Security. The attack, which began in June 2025, compromised the personal and employment data of staff at the Federal Emergency Management A...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Vulnerability, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Chinese APT Salt Typhoon Targets European Telecom with SNAPPYBEE Backdoor
item.description:
The Chinese state-sponsored group Salt Typhoon has been observed targeting a European telecommunications firm by exploiting a known Citrix NetScaler vulnerability for initial access. Post-exploitation, the attackers deployed a backdoor known as SNAPPYBEE (or Deed RAT) using DLL side-loading techniqu...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: 'GlassWorm' Worm Uses Unicode Obfuscation and Solana C2 in VS Code Supply Chain Attack
item.description:
A highly sophisticated, self-propagating worm named 'GlassWorm' is targeting Visual Studio developers through malicious extensions on the OpenVSX marketplace. The malware employs advanced evasion techniques, including using invisible Unicode characters to obfuscate its code and leveraging the Solana...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Russian APT COLDRIVER Rapidly Deploys New NOROBOT Malware After Public Disclosure
item.description:
The Russian state-sponsored threat group COLDRIVER, also known as Star Blizzard and UNC4057, has demonstrated remarkable operational agility by deploying new malware families just five days after its LOSTKEYS malware was publicly disclosed in May 2025. According to Google's Threat Intelligence Group...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ransomware Attacks on Critical Industries Skyrocket by 34%, KELA Reports
item.description:
A new report from cyber intelligence firm KELA reveals a staggering 34% year-over-year increase in ransomware attacks targeting critical industries between January and September 2025. These vital sectors, including manufacturing, healthcare, and energy, accounted for half of all 4,701 recorded globa...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Intelligence, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: UK Regulators Issue Cyber Recovery Guide for Financial Firms
item.description:
The United Kingdom's top financial regulators—the Bank of England (BoE), the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA), and the Prudential Regulation Authority (PRA)—have jointly published a guide on effective cyber response and recovery practices. The guidance, aimed at all financial firms, emphasizes the ...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Incident Response

Read Full Article →

item.title: EU Launches Cybersecurity Reserve to Bolster Incident Response Across Member States
item.description:
The European Union has officially established the European Cybersecurity Reserve as a key component of its Cyber Solidarity Act. Managed by the EU Agency for Cybersecurity (ENISA), the reserve has a €36 million budget and consists of 45 pre-vetted, trusted private providers, such as Airbus Protect a...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Incident Response

Read Full Article →

item.title: 'Cavalry Werewolf' APT Targets Russian Critical Infrastructure with Custom Malware
item.description:
The Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group known as Cavalry Werewolf (also tracked as YoroTrooper and Silent Lynx) conducted a targeted cyberattack campaign against Russia's public sector and critical industries between May and August 2025. The group leveraged spear-phishing emails to deliver custom...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Malware

Read Full Article →
